gi2mo:Idea.gi2mo:content: a touch screen board. You could use it for presentation. You would have to use a special pen made for the screen to write on it. It would be a transparent glass but with touch display innovation.
A touch display could be added to restaurant tables to make orders, questions and concerns a seamless experience.

A tablet to go. Instead of carrying around a physical tablet, the coating could be carried instead to turn any surface into a touch tablet, like a liquid. It could even use microprocessor and RAM technology within the coating, as well as data storage. The coating would be in a small container.
vanity or bathroom mirror that shows news, time, weather, sports

This could be applied to a wall of a home. This would essentially turn the entire wall into a computer, or TV, screen, eliminating the need for televisions. It would also be invisible when not turned on.
I would put this coating on my hand, so I can carry it anywhere I go and do stuff I want
A bathroom mirror to check the weather before leaving the house.
Spray on a wall to play videos games.
A bathroom mirror would be great with a touch display, because as you're getting ready for work, you can catch up on the morning news or get a jumpstart on reading and returning emails.
A temporary multitouch display to extend your screen size while doing a task that needs some extra screen space.
A bush trimmer that shows the desired bush size, the amount you've already trimmed, and how much is remaining for the desired trim. A picture of the bush with progression would be displayed.
digital medical personal medical history
coffee table that allows you to control your TV, music, home automation, etc
It could be applied to the dash of a car. This could eliminate the need for stereo systems or navigation systems in cars. The dash would completely integrate the interface.
A door handle that turns on your lights when you open the door at night.
Sports bars tables could become individual televisions.
I feel like it would be very useful to have all of you car buttons to be coated on to the dashboard.
On the kitchen counter. You could have a section where you could always bring up recipes and instructions.
A touch display window which could control automated blinds and window locks.
Coat entire walls for theater movie experiences.
Applied to car exterior for customizable colors and styles.
A touch screen for certain closets so you dont have to go in and have everything already set up so you can find it with a search function.
A touch display would be useful on the door of a refrigerator. It could keep your grocery list, left over dates and expiration dates all in one spot. No more wasting food!
If it is not harmful to the skin, this could be applied to one's arm. Then, a person's arm could essentially be a touchpad portal to the internet, without having to use any devices.
A auto toilet system can be made out of it for sure
Make your gaming controller a touch display.
Make your keyboard a touch display.
An alarm system that can only be accessed with your touch and unlocks your house for you.
create a touchscreen microwave.
It could be used as a wall poster that can display any image you want, even moving images.
Walls that can be any color or pattern.
A Robot Car That Does The Driving For You
A compilation of games that can be used like tic-tac-toe and other simple games with a setting to find each game.
A touch display on the door of your fridge, on which you can take notes or see what's nearing the expiry date.
car window
frosted window
i would make an auotcleaning option
You can have an athletic shirt sleeve that gives you feedback on your heart rate, perspiration amounts, breathing rate, etc.
You could make a touch mirror that shows you outfits or hair.
A text-messaging device that sends texts to any other user with it.
Touch display door that has the keypad on a screen in the door.
On the outside of a house, as a video screen for security. People inside could see who is outside and communicate with them through the screen.
fishtank
Touchscreen food machine that will personalize food options to create.
Toy that is a like a rubik's cube but the sides are all touch displays.
Pizza Box That Separates Into Plates And Stores Leftovers
clothes can interact with your phone and computer
A big touch display on your door so that you can open it with a code and not use a key.
an eyeglass case that holds multiple pairs of eyeglasses
Use the coating on windows and tap on the window to identify people, cars, wildlife, etc.
Put it on walls in schools to replace chalk boards and make learning more interactive.
a drop-down menu I can apply to any program at any time. The menu would contain frequently typed items missed or misunderstood by auto-fill
touch display appliances

you could turn a blank wall into a pc gamers dream monitor and make it so that if you held a special game weapon you could play CoD or that sort of game interactively and make it feel as if you were actually there
smart homes
Apply to desk tops for ease
drive-through menu
Put it on your purse. You would always have access to a display screen and could take notes where ever you go.
Apply to swing sets or play yard equipment for browsing out of doors.
Home theatre
you can apply it on a guitar to regulate volume, tone and maybe even sound effects like echo, reverb, etc.
You can apply it on your car windscreen and make it like a jet fighter HUD!
A touchscreen on my cabinet. I could use it to pull up recipes or search for ideas for dinner.
Apply on a desk and use its surface as a keyboard / input device
Apply it on patio tables for browsing outdoors.
Put it on your refrigerator to leave notes for people.
coffee table could have remote control built in
personal holographs
Having it over a window in order to change the scenery when you look out the window.
you can leave a note on some money that you are paying someone with about what you would like to tip them like if you are in a restaruant

You could use the coating on the front of back of books that indicate the page numbers of important passages or when you starting reading the point or it could have a timer that shows each time you starting and stopped reading the book. The coating would allow you to take notes that would always be with the book when you carry it around
You could make your front door (or any door) open-able using various methods from a simple symbol lock system, to a more complex set of button presses.
refrigerator door could have keyboard for adding items to a grocery list
Use the kitchen counter in a home to order food items.
Apply to arms or chairs and couches for convenient access
Wardrobe that tells you how much space is left inside after putting in clothes.
a touch display on restaurant tables, so you can view menus, coupons and order food at the table without having to call a waiter or go to the register.
A window where you can control how much light gets in by swiping
Cpat the tops of a table and it could be used for different games. Like board games or pen and paper RPGs.
a touchscreen computer desk with windows operating system
Make television remotes more innovative and interactive.
A pet food distribution center where the animal can tap the screen and receive a treat or meal. Would allow for healthy regulation and training.
that coating could be used on human body like arm, hand etc
An entire wall or room could be a touch display. I'm thinking an entire interactive room. A bigger room could potentially become an IMAX movie theater.
Your coffee table is a touch screen tablet
Smart clothes
On kitchen cabinets and it could display what's inside without opening them
It could be placed on a closet so that you can put items together to make and outfit without having to try everything on. It would show you pictures of the different pieces.
You could add it to a box to keep try of the contents.
Products have any type of glass. That can make the touch display. Actually maximum product have glass types.
Libraries could have a screen where patrons can look for books.
A refrigerator where you can create a shopping list by tapping on products
Put on a bicycle so handle so you could touch it for new maps or gps without having to use a phone which could drop.
A plain clipboard that can be used as a personal tablet.
Can turn an ordinary television into a touch television.
Touch screen tables in a restaurant where you can order your food and pay.
A touch display could be added to the bathroom shower tile in order to more finely tune the shower water temperature, pressure, spray format etc.
Apply to walls of home for anywhere access
Refrigerator touchscreen that can adjust the temperature and humidity.
A portable piano
touchscreen in the bathroom to select water temperature and water pressure in the shower
A fish tank with a coating on it that shows the touch display of the temperature so you can adjust it right on the tank.
can make toilets touch capable.
a device where you can spray in side a car dashboard. the dashboard then tells you the mph you are going and other car related information such as temperature
Turn the walls of your house into a virtual paint canvas
super interactive toys
Put it on a wall to create the world's flattest television
A touchscreen for the bathroom to regulate the water temperature in the shower and also be used as a radio or television.
Flip Flops With Interchangeable, Velcro Straps So You Can Switch Your Look Without Buying Multiple Pairs
Make a refrigerator have a touch panel to control things in it.
can make floors and walls touch with options.
Use it on car paint so you can unlock with your fingerprint or code.
A more interactive smartwatch
A long armband fitted around the wrist that would act as a display for wearable gadgets.
A auto cleaning vaccum cleaner can be made out of it for sure
On a window to allow you to view a better landscape if you don't like your real view
Doors that can automatically lock themselves through the use of a touch display.
You could make a desk top that was a touch display at work.
A kitchen counter that could display cooking recipes. You could flip through pages etc and add recipes of your own
you could have a section of the countertop in the kitchen where you could just use your finger to write a grocery list
kitchen appliances can be more interactive
Use it on magazines to make article information clickable.
You could turn your front yard into any location you want to be or to create a dance floor and have a party
A touch display in the restroom on the wall near the toilet so when you are using the toilet, you can browse the internet,

a hand screen where you spay it on your hand and it temporarily acts as a body information device where you see your body temperature along with heart rate and body mass index among other things related to your health
desks could be used for education or to give displays in business.
You could use it on all the windows in your home making every window in your home have a different scenery
Put it on a mirror to let people view what different outfits or hairstyles or makeup would look like on them
touch screen mirror to help you change the lights and see better
A lawn mower with the touch display sprayed on that shows how well the grass is being cut.
Put the coating on car tires to display air pressure
